snippet: In his State of the State speech, Gov. Chris Christie urged Washington to approve storm relief funds, saying residents had waited “seven times longer than victims of Hurricane Katrina.”
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie presses Congress in State of the State address to approve storm relief funds; recalls the devastation in New Jersey from Hurricane Sandy and tales of individual fortitude in the aftermath.
lead_paragraph: In his State of the State speech, Gov. Chris Christie urged Washington to approve storm relief funds, saying residents had waited “seven times longer than victims of Hurricane Katrina.”

headline.seo: In State of State Address, Gov. Chris Christie Urges Approval of Storm Relief
headline.main: Christie Lauds New Jersey’s Fortitude and Presses Congress for Storm Funds
headline.print_headline: Christie Lauds New Jersey’s Fortitude and Presses Congress for Storm Aid
